'''Boundary, Inc.''' is a privately owned [[corporation]] based in [[San Francisco, CA]].<ref name="CB">{{Citation | publisher = CrunchBase| title = Boundary| url = http://www.crunchbase.com/company/boundary| accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="VB">{{Citation | publisher = Venturebeatprofiles| title = Boundary Overview| url = http://venturebeatprofiles.com/company/profile/boundary | accessdate = }}</ref> The company focuses on using [[big data]] analytics and real time [[application software|app]] performance analysis to help corporations better manage the performance of their business critical applications.<ref name="BCC"> {{Citation | publisher = Boundary.com| title = Cloudant Boosts Cloud Database Performance With Boundary and Splunk | url = http://boundary.com/blog/2012/10/04/cloudant-boosts-cloud-database-performance-with-boundary-and-splunk/| accessdate = October 4, 2012 }}</ref><ref name="JAX">{{Citation | publisher = Jaxenter| title = Big data monitoring in real-time - Q&A with Gary Read, Boundary | url = http://jaxenter.com/big-data-monitoring-in-real-time-q-a-with-gary-read-boundary-41703.html | accessdate = March 27, 2012 }}</ref><ref name="NYT">{{Citation| first = Quentin| last = Hardy | publisher = New York Times| title = Boundary: Keeping Cloud Software in Shape | url = http://bits.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/08/15/boundary-keeping-cloud-software-in-shape/ | accessdate = August 15, 2012}}</ref> This helps companies better understand fluctuating data flow and therefore control [[Information technology|IT]] operational costs, as well as trouble-shoot previously undetected problems and predict system performance.<ref name="BYT"> {{Citation | publisher = Youtube | title = Boundary Startup Monitors Your High Performance Network | url = http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N31jg8ZhwfI| accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="NYT"/><ref name="WSJ">{{Citation | publisher = WSJ| title = Cloudant Boosts Cloud Database Performance With Boundary and Splunk | url = http://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20121002-903899.html| accessdate = October 2, 2012 }}</ref> Boundary's client list includes [[GitHub]], [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], [[Urban Airship]], and [[Cloudant]].<ref name="WSJ"/><ref name="INF">{{Citation| url=http://www.informationweek.com/cloud-computing/software/boundary-tracks-app-performance-even-in/240154518| title=Boundary Tracks App Performance, Even In AWS| publisher=Information Week| accessdate=23 May 2013}}</ref>
==Company background==
Ben Black and Cliff Moon founded Boundary in January 2011.<ref name="BBW">{{Citation | publisher = Bloomberg Businessweek | title = Company Overview of Boundary, Inc.| url = http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=133505547| accessdate = December 27, 2012}}</ref><ref name="BYT"/> Black served as ENC director at [[Microsoft]] Windows Live before joining [[Amazon.com|Amazon]] as Website Engineering manager.<ref name="BBZ">{{Citation | publisher = Zoominfo | title = Mr. Benjamin Black| url = http://www.zoominfo.com/#!search/profile/person?personId=1320957407&targetid=profile | accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="BYT"/> Moon graduated from the [[University of Delaware]] in 2005 with a BS in CIS after attending the Florida Institute of Technology for a year.<ref name="CML">{{Citation | publisher = LinkedIn| title = Cliff Moon | url = http://www.linkedin.com/pub/cliff-moon/4/44b/283| accessdate = }}</ref> He was with Powerset, then Microsoft/Bing.<ref name="BYT"/> Before that, he was with Chariot Solutions and Fort Hill Company.<ref name="CML"/><ref name=SAN>{{Citation|url=http://siliconangle.com/blog/2013/05/14/boundary-the-first-cloud-based-it-operations-management-system/|title = Boundary – the First Cloud-based IT Operations Management System| publisher = Silicon Angle| accessdate = 23 May 2013.}}</ref> Boundary acquired Series A Venture Equity Funding in the amount of $4M in early 2011.<ref name="XC">{{Citation | publisher = Xconomy| title = Boundary Lands $4,000,000 Series A Funding | url = http://www.xconomy.com/san-francisco/2011/11/15/boundary-lands-4000000-series-a-funding/ | accessdate = November 15, 2012 }}</ref> This was followed by a Series B round of $15 million in July 2012, led by Scale Venture Partners and existing investor, Lightspeed Venture Partners.<ref name="BPR">{{Citation | publisher = Boundary.com| title = Press Releases | url = http://boundary.com/company/press-news/| accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="VB"/> The company’s [[CEO]] and president is [[Gary Read]].<ref name="BLI">{{Citation | publisher = LinkedIn| title = Boundary| url = http://www.linkedin.com/company/boundary | accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="MSP">{{Citation | first = Joe | last = Panettieri| publisher = MSPMentor | title = Boundary Makes Big Data Cloud, Application Monitoring Moves| url = http://www.mspmentor.net/2012/08/09/boundary-networks-makes-big-data-cloud-monitoring-moves/| accessdate = August 9, 2012 }}</ref><ref name="PEC">{{Citation | publisher = Private Equity Capital | title = Boundary Hires Gary Read as CEO| url = http://www.capital-private-equity.com/2012/01/19/boundary-hires-gary-read-as-ceo/ | accessdate = January 19, 2012 }}</ref> The company has raised $19 million in revenues and expanded to 35 employees since its startup in 2011.<ref name="VB"/><ref name=BJO>{{Citation|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/print-edition/2013/05/17/boundary-sets-the-clouds-limits.html| title = Boundary sets the cloud’s limits|publisher = San Francisco Business Times| accessdate = 23 May 2013.}}</ref>
==Product==
Boundary is an app performance analysis for modern application infrastructures including public and private clouds.<ref name="BCC"/><ref name="BP">{{Citation | publisher = Boundary.com | title = A New Approach to Application Performance Monitoring| url = http://boundary.com/product/| accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="BYT"/> It is a real-time, SaaS-based, solution for monitoring cloud environments.<ref name="AWS">{{Citation | publisher = AWS Marketplace| title = Boundary| url = https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B0082FE9O8 | accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="FT>{{Citation|url=http://www.theregister.co.uk/2013/05/07/boundary_fortune_teller/|title=Boundary app monitor becomes a fortune teller| publisher = The Register|accessdate = 23 May 2013.}}</ref><ref name="BCC"/> Boundary allows user to visualize their application traffic and system behavior.<ref name="SS">{{Citation | publisher = Slideshare| title = Boundary | url = http://www.slideshare.net/boundaryinc/boundary-front-end-tech-talk-how-it-works#btnNextSS| accessdate = }}</ref><ref name="XC"/> Boundary collects data from both the cloud and private or public data centers to detect performance issues ahead of time.<ref name="BP"/><ref name="BYT"/> Boundary uses the collected data to monitor applications in real-time.<ref name="SS"/><ref name="VB"/> Its metered data creates opportunities for predictive analytics and data exploration.<ref name="BP"/><ref name="BYT"/><ref name="JAX"/> Boundary ties a number of different alert systems from multiple applications into a single pane.<ref name="SS"/><ref name=VTR>{{Citation|url=http://www.v3.co.uk/v3-uk/news/2266180/boundary-looks-to-simplify-it-infrastructure-management|title = Boundary looks to simplify IT infrastructure management| publisher = V3|accessdate = 23 May 2013.}}</ref><ref name=BJO>{{Citation|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/print-edition/2013/05/17/boundary-sets-the-clouds-limits.html| title = Boundary sets the cloud’s limits|publisher = San Francisco Business Times| accessdate = 23 May 2013.}}</ref>
